main event: A civilian observed a high yellow object that seemed to lose and gain altitude before disappearing in St. Vrain, New Mexico on August 25, 1967.
interesting points: The object was initially thought to be a meteor but did not burn out as expected., The sighting lasted for about 14 minutes., The observer noted the object gained altitude after initially losing it., There were additional witnesses mentioned, including a truck driver and civilians at White Sands., A temperature inversion may have affected the appearance of the object's altitude.
sighted object: a high yellow object resembling a missile re-entry
